intro: Senecio boninsimae, commonly known as the Bonin Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
